benchmark_details.name: hmBlogs: A big general Persian corpus
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces the hmBlogs corpus for Persian, as a low resource language. This corpus has been prepared based on a collection of nearly 20 million blog posts over a period of about 15 years from a space of Persian blogs and includes more than 6.8 billion tokens.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a large, open, and general corpus for the Persian language, aimed at improving natural language processing for low resource languages.

data.source: Crawled from Persian blogs on Blogfa.

methods: Evaluation using analogy tests and semantic relatedness
methodology.calculation: Evaluated based on the performance of word embedding models trained on the corpus.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy percentages indicate better performance of the word embedding models.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against other Persian corpora such as irBlogs and PRT.
methodology.validation: Corpus evaluated through various models and methods.
